statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Kerry Kittles had his second straight strong game with 23 points to lead a balanced attack as the surprising Nets posted a 96-84 victory over the Cleveland Cavaliers.
article.headline: Nets follow big win with easy win over Cavs
article.linkText: No letdown for Nets, who take care of business vs. Cavs
article.story:
EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J. (AP) -- Here's another sign the New Jersey Nets are getting better: They didn't suffer a big letdown.
Kidd

Kittles

Two days after helping Jason Kidd get a measure of revenge against the Phoenix Suns and Stephon Marbury, Kerry Kittles scored 23 points and Nets overcame a sub-par game by beating Cleveland 96-84 Friday night. "It's a great win for us," Keith Van Horn said after the Nets won for the 12th time in 18 games, their best start since joining the NBA in 1976. "We struggled earlier this year when we had a really big game and came back flat." That was last month, when the Nets did a number on the cross-river rival New York Knicks on a Friday night and then failed to show up the following night at home against Philadelphia. There was no repeat this time. Two days after handling the Suns 106-87 in the first game between the teams since the Kidd-Marbury trade, New Jersey found a way to win despite struggling. "We showed a lot of character coming back off an emotional win," said Kidd, who had 11 points, nine assists and seven rebounds. "We learned from our mistakes of last time." Kenyon Martin had 14 of his 19 points in the second half, Van Horn added 17 points and Todd MacCulloch had 12 points and 10 rebounds as New Jersey beat the Cavaliers for the second time this season. Despite getting 19 points in 18 minutes from center Zydrunas Ilgauskas in his second game of the season, Cleveland coach John Lucas was annoyed because the Cavaliers didn't do what the Nets did. Cleveland (7-12) failed to follow up after a big win over Detroit on Tuesday night. "Getting Detroit was one division leader," Lucas said. "This would have been a second division leader in a week. That's too much prosperity for us right now." Lamond Murray added 24 points, only five in the second half as Cleveland lost its fourth straight on the road. Cleveland point guard Andre Miller was limited to eight points after scoring a career-high 34 against Detroit in his last game. "We couldn't make shots," Lucas said. "They made shots at the end of the shot clock. They got second back opportunities. We just looked sluggish tonight." The Nets, who led 44-42 at halftime, never trailed in the second half but couldn't put away Cleveland until the final minutes. A jumper by Ricky Davis got Cleveland within 81-77 with 6:12 to play. However MacCulloch hit two free throws and a dunk and Kittles hit a jumper to push the lead to 87-77 with 4:37 to go. Cleveland never got closer than eight points after that.

Game notes
New Jersey is 8-2 at home this season. ... Miller's consecutive games streak is now 183. ... Ilgauskas (6-of-9 from the field) missed the first 17 games of the season while rehabilitating from foot surgery...Coming into this season, Cleveland had won 10 of 12 against the Nets. ... Jeff Trepagnier of the Cavs and Brian Scalabrine of the Nets were teammates at Southern California last season. Both are on the injured list. ... The Nets did not win their 12th game last season until Jan. 15. ... Attendance was 8,209.
